prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** Construct the base of the prism by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. 1. **Sketch on the X-Y plane:** a. Draw the first line from point (0.0, 0.004) to point (0.4532, 0.0). b. Draw the second line from point (0.4532, 0.0) to point (0.4532, 0.5757). c. Draw the third line from point (0.4532, 0.5757) to point (0.1955, 0.75). d. Draw the fourth line from point (0.1955, 0.75) to point (0.0, 0.5936). e. Draw the fifth line from point (0.0, 0.5936) to point (0.0, 0.004). 2. **Extrusion:** a. Scale the sketch by 0.75. b. Extrude the sketch by 0.1745 units in the normal direction. c. Perform the "New Body Feature Operation" for the final shape. **Part 2: Second Tapered Rectangular Prism** Construct the top prism by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0967, 0.1009, 0.1745. 1. **Sketch on the X-Y plane:** a. Draw the first line from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.2298, 0.0). b. Draw the second line from point (0.2298, 0.0) to point (0.2298, 0.4576). c. Draw the third line from point (0.2298, 0.4576) to point (0.0, 0.4576). d. Draw the fourth line from point (0.0, 0.4576) to point (0.0, 0.0). 2. **Extrusion:** a. Scale the sketch by 0.4576. b. Extrude the sketch by 0.1745 units in the normal direction. c. Perform the "Join Feature Operation" for the final shape. After completing these instructions, you will have created a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom.</description>
